intro: Mesosphaerum affine, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mesosphaerum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Scrophulariaceae. It is native to parts of South Africa, particularly the Western and Eastern Cape provinces. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale green to yellowish in color, with five petals arranged in a symmetrical pattern. Mesosphaerum affine is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to semi-arid environments.
